賽.definition: to compete; competition; match; to surpass; better than; superior to; to excel

賽先生.definition: "Mr Science", phrase used during the May 4th Movement 五四運動|五四运动[Wu3 si4 Yun4 dong4]; abbr. for 賽因斯|赛因斯[sai4 yin1 si1]; see also 德先生[De2 xian1 sheng5]

賽制.definition: competition format; tournament system (e.g. round robin, single-elimination knockout etc)

賽夏族.definition: Saisiyat or Saisiat, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

賽德克族.definition: Seediq, one of the indigenous peoples of Taiwan

賽德娜.definition: Sedna, small body in the outer reaches of the solar system

賽氏籬鶯.definition: (bird species of China) Sykes's warbler (Iduna rama)

賽珍珠.definition: Pearl S. Buck (1892-1973), American writer known for her novels on Asian cultures, Pulitzer Prize and Nobel Prize laureate

賽程.definition: competition schedule; the course of a race

賽罕.definition: Saihan District of Hohhot City 呼和浩特市[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4 Shi4], Inner Mongolia

賽罕區.definition: Saihan District of Hohhot City 呼和浩特市[Hu1 he2 hao4 te4 Shi4], Inner Mongolia

賽船.definition: boat race; racing ship or boat

賽艇.definition: boat race; racing ship or boat; rowing (sport)

賽車.definition: auto race; cycle race; race car

賽車女郎.definition: pit babe; paddock girl; grid girl

賽輪思.definition: Cerence, US company providing AI-based automotive assistants

賽馬場.definition: race course; race ground; race track

賽馬會.definition: the Jockey Club, Hong Kong philanthropic organization (and former gentleman's club)
